adverb.description: In a way that creates a wide piece of something.
examples: the meat was too thickly cut and impossible to chew

adverb.description: In a closely compacted or crowded manner.

examples: "Isn't he a politician?" I say rather thickly

adverb.description: With a hoarse or husky voice; indistinctly.
examples: "You woke me up," he said thickly
